perturbation.original_text: 1.1 HDI shall design, develop, implement, operate, maintain and manage, and enable the Company to establish a presence on the World Wide Web ("Site") to make available to Internet users on demand, men's and women's apparel and accessories from the Deerskin Catalog ("Deerskin Products"). As used in this Agreement, "Deerskin Products" shall not include (i) closeout merchandise which the Company may identify as "Deerskin" branded items, if such is the case, nor (ii) products from the Company's Joan Cook Catalog.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 HDI shall design, develop, implement, operate, maintain and manage, and enable the Company to establish a presence on the World Wide Web ("Webpage") to make available to Internet users on demand, men's and women's apparel and accessories from the Deerskin Catalog ("Deerskin Goods"). As used in this Agreement, "Deerskin Goods" shall not include (i) closeout merchandise which the Company may identify as "Deerskin" branded items, if such is the case, nor (ii) products from the Company's Joan Cook Catalog.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Site' to 'Webpage' and 'Deerskin Products' to 'Deerskin Goods' introduces ambiguity. The contract consistently refers to 'Site' later on, so this change will cause confusion about if the term 'Webpage' is different than 'Site'. Similarly for 'Deerskin Products' and 'Deerskin Goods'.

perturbation.original_text: 5.4 Each of HDI and the Company shall appoint a General Manager of its own to act as liaison with the other Party for the Site (each a "General Manager") who shall bear sole responsibility for bookkeeping and business operations of the Site on a day-to-day basis. Each General Manager shall have the authority to make and convey decisions on behalf of each Party and to be the liaison with the other Party for all production and Content matters.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4 Each of HDI and the Company shall appoint a Project Lead of its own to act as liaison with the other Party for the Webpage (each a "Project Lead") who shall bear sole responsibility for bookkeeping and business operations of the Webpage on a day-to-day basis. Each Project Lead shall have the authority to make and convey decisions on behalf of each Party and to be the liaison with the other Party for all production and Content matters.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'General Manager' to 'Project Lead' and 'Site' to 'Webpage' introduces ambiguity regarding the roles and responsibilities. It is unclear if 'Project Lead' is equivalent to the defined 'General Manager,' and if 'Webpage' is the same as 'Site,' causing confusion regarding who is responsible for what.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1 The Company shall pay HDI thirty percent (3016) of the Net Sales in excess of Eleven Thousand Dollars ($11,000) per calendar month. "Net Sales" shall mean all revenues from the sale of Deerskin Products on the Site including shipping and handling charges, minus refunds and exchanges.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 The Company shall pay HDI thirty percent (30%) of the Net Revenue in excess of Eleven Thousand Dollars ($11,000) per calendar month. "Net Revenue" shall mean all revenues from the sale of Deerskin Goods on the Webpage including shipping and handling charges, minus returns and discounts.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Net Sales' to 'Net Revenue', 'Deerskin Products' to 'Deerskin Goods,' 'Site' to 'Webpage' and 'refunds and exchanges' to 'returns and discounts' creates contradiction. Are Net Sales and Net Revenue referring to the same metric, and are refunds/exchanges different than returns/discounts? This alters the financial obligations and creates grounds for disagreement on payment calculations.
